page.title: 08Worsley Old Hall
page.content: It was called Worsley Old Hall because there ws a Worsley New Hall just down the road. The complete house was finished in 1519. The shape of the building was E shaped. Surrounding the house there is a large garden of six acres. Separating the gardens from the fields is a special ditch called a Ha Ha. Inside the hall some of the roof beams were said to be old ship's timbers. Many of the windows were very small, one of them dating from 1639. Some of the rooms were wood panelled. Two important families have lived in the house. They were the Egertons and the Bridgewaters. James Brindley planned the Bridgewater Canal from the house. We went into the original cellars which are a series of brick arches. The man who took us round was Mr Smith. He was dressed in a costume dating from about 1630.
